channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Don’t Cry for Catherine Deneuve
item.description: The President’s Wife shows how to defend a first lady.

item.title: Don’t Force Sex and Gender Ideology on Little Kids
item.description: The Supreme Court should recognize that parents have a right to shield their young kids from sex and gender indoctrination in public school.

item.title: Rep. Barr to run for McConnell's Senate seat in GOP primary
item.description: Rep. Andy Barr announced Tuesday fthat he will run for Kentucky's U.S. Senate seat in 2026, looking to replace longtime Republican leader Mitch McConn...

item.title: EPA fires or reassigns hundreds working on 'environmental justice'
item.description: President Donald Trump's administration took aim at "environmental justice" programs at the EPA on Monday, eliminating hundreds of jobs.

item.title: Nikki Haley on Russia and Ukraine says US should 'want to be on the right side of history'
item.description: Former U.S. Ambassador to the UN Nikki Haley suggested that the U.S. should "want to be on the right side of history" regarding the Russia-Ukraine war...

item.title: Bill Targets Indiana Treasurer Who Stops Banks From Canceling Christians, Gun Owners
item.description: Indiana's treasurer helped push banks to back down on canceling conservatives, and now a banker-backed bill would strip his office's powers.

item.title: What is the highly coveted H-1B visa? Trump administration moves put attention on the program
item.description: The H-1B visa has long been a highly coveted employment visa for foreign citizens with specialized skills to live and work in the U.S., and recent req...

item.title: Gingrich says Trump note shows he wants to avoid raising taxes
item.description: Former House Speaker Newt Gingrich said Tuesday that President Trump told him he has no plans to raise taxes on anyone.

item.title: Pennsylvania Gov. Shapiro says Trump called him about arson attack: 'Very gracious'
item.description: Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro said President Donald Trump called him over the weekend to discuss the arson attack on the governor's mansion.

item.title: Marines Don’t Betray Allies and Reward Foes
item.description: The Ukrainian people are fighting for the same values for which Marines and American men and women throughout our history have fought and died.

item.title: Young Americans sour on congressional Democrats, new poll finds
item.description: The latest Harvard Youth Poll by the university's Institute of Politics indicates that the approval rating for congressional Democrats has plunged amo...

item.title: Another Problem with Medicaid: It’s Pushing Women Toward Abortion
item.description: Directing federal dollars to prenatal care could result in a better long-term financial picture if it helps Americans more readily welcome children.

item.title: Colorado fights Trump administration bid to help imprisoned loyalist Tina Peters
item.description: Colorado's chief deputy attorney general urged a federal judge on Tuesday to reject the Trump administration's unprecedented bid to help an imprisoned...

item.title: Jackson, Mississippi, mayor facing federal bribery charges trails challenger in mayoral election results
item.description: The federally indicted mayor of Jackson, Mississippi, Chokwe Antar Lumumba, is trailing his opponent in the city’s Democratic primary runoff.

item.title: 15 Gifts To Celebrate Your Favorite Graduates That Aren’t Cash
item.description: If you know someone graduating high school or college and you'd like to gift something personal, try one of these thoughful options.

item.title: Forcing a Meta Breakup Would Be Bad News for Consumers
item.description: As the Meta case continues, the focus must be on consumers, not companies or competitors.

item.title: ‘Conceiving Crime’ Podcast Tells Horrors Of Abortion, Fertility Industries That Corporate Media Won’t
item.description: 'It's about reclaiming the light and encouraging the listener to take a moment to consider their worldviews,' Parker said.

item.title: ‘Fact-Checking’ Was Always Just Censorship. Polls Show Americans Could See Through It
item.description: Americans understand the goal of 'fact-checking' — not objective truth, but spreading left-wing propaganda and silencing dissent.

item.title: ‘Tough Case To Argue’: SCOTUS Poised To Back Parental Opt-Out For LGBT Content In School

item.title: Judge rules administration must produce evidence in Abrego Garcia deportation
